thread.title: Man found dead outside home in Highland Creek was shot, police say
thread.title_full: Man found dead outside home in Highland Creek was shot, police say | CP24.com

author: Chris Herhalt, CP24.com
title: Man found dead outside home in Highland Creek was shot, police say
text:
Toronto police say a man found dead outside a home in Scarboroughâ€™s Highland Creek neighbourhood early Thursday morning suffered a gunshot wound.
A staff sergeant from Toronto police 43 Division said police were called to a small two-storey home at 6496 Kingston Road, west of Ellesmere Road, at 2:17 a.m. on Thursday for a report of a dead body.
A man was found without vital signs somewhere in or around the home and pronounced dead at the scene, police and paramedics said.
Const. Victor Kwong said the man, a 37-year-old from Toronto was found on the driveway of the home, suffering from a gunshot wound.
Homicide investigators have taken over the scene. A post-mortem examination is scheduled for Friday.
Neighbours told CP24 that they heard loud popping sounds similar to fireworks overnight. Police officers were seen canvassing the neighbourhood, appealing for witnesses and checking nearby buildings for surveillance camera footage.
Photos A police forensic investigation service truck seen near Ellesmere and Kingston roads on Thursday, Oct. 1. (Mike Nguyen/CP24)
